a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Dietary land use vs. beef consumption, 2009 to 2011
The percentage of global habitable land area needed for agriculture if the total world population was to adopt the
average diet of any given country versus annual per capita beef consumption. Globally we use approximately
50% of habitable land for agriculture, as shown by the grey horizontal line.
Data source: HALF Index (Land Use) - Alexander et al. (2016); Our World In Data; Food and Agriculture Organization of the United
Note: Figures show beef supply and do not correct for waste at the household level and, so they may not directly reflect the quantity of
food consumed by a given individual.
